metadata.title: CVE-2021-28277 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A Heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerabilty exists in jhead 3.04 and 3.05 is affected by: Buffer Overflow via the RemoveUnknownSections function in jpgfile.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28277` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

jhead - 1:3.06.0.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jhead package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.06.0.1-2').
